verses.text: \sc Love\sc* righteousness, ye that be judges of the earth: think of the Lord with a good heart, and in simplicity of heart seek him.
For he will be found of them that tempt him not; and sheweth himself unto such as do not distrust him.
For froward thoughts separate from God: and \add his\add* power, when it is tried, reproveth the unwise.
For into a malicious soul wisdom shall not enter; nor dwell in the body \add that is\add* subject unto sin.
For the holy spirit of discipline will flee deceit, and remove from thoughts \add that are\add* without understanding, and will not abide when unrighteousness cometh in.
For wisdom \add is\add* a loving spirit; and will not acquit a blasphemer of his words: for God \add is\add* witness of his reins, and a true beholder of his heart, and a hearer of his tongue.
For the Spirit of the Lord filleth the world: and that which containeth all \add things\add* hath knowledge of the voice.
Therefore he that speaketh unrighteous \add things\add* cannot be hid: neither shall vengeance, when it punisheth, pass by him.
For inquisition shall be made into the counsels of the ungodly: and the sound of his words shall come unto the Lord for the manifestation of his wicked deeds.
For the ear of jealousy heareth all \add things:\add* and the noise of murmurings is not hid.

Therefore beware of murmuring, \add which is\add* unprofitable; and refrain \add your\add* tongue from backbiting: for there is no word \add so\add* secret, \add that\add* shall go for nought: and the mouth that belieth slayeth the soul.
Seek not death in the error of your life: and pull not upon yourselves destruction with the works of your hands.
For God made not death: neither hath he pleasure in the destruction of the living.

For he created all \add things\add*, that \add they\add* might have their being: and the generations of the world \add were\add* healthful; and there is no poison of destruction in them, nor the kingdom of death upon the earth:

but ungodly \add men\add* with \add their\add* works and words called it to \add them: for\add* when they thought \add to have it their\add* friend, they consumed to nought, and made a covenant with it, because they are worthy to take part with it.
